isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Use with Circuit Diagram Book CTS-5122W.

This chapter covers International installed components and circuits that directly interact with the Cummins M11E and N14E CELECT PLUS Electronic Engine Controls. CELECT PLUS is the name of the Cummins' heavy duty engines with a full authority fuel control injection system.

item.para: Provides operation descriptions of International installed components and circuits that work with the Cummins Electronic Engine Controls.
Provides Troubleshooting Charts for those circuits and components installed by International.
Provides locations for International installed circuits.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The Cummins Electronic Troubleshooting Manuals should be used to diagnose the engine control system, then use the step-by-step troubleshooting charts included in the TROUBLESHOOTING section.
Cummins publications can be ordered from local Cummins Distributors or from:
Refer to the circuit diagram in CTS-5122W for the following discussions.
The M11E and N14E controller provides many engine/vehicle functions including:
Refer to the Cummins Engine Manual furnished with the vehicle for additional feature information.

Since each engine control system is electronically programmable to individual owner specifications, the operating parameters will vary from vehicle to vehicle. These parameters include: maximum cruise speed, shift schedules, governor type (automotive type or variable speed), idle RPM, full engine shutdown as part of the engine protection system and many others.

The electronic control module (ECM) is the control center of the CELECT PLUS system. The ECM receives input from Cummins and International sensors and switches, processes the information, then uses electrical signals to control engine and vehicle functions.
The ECM receives inputs from International installed components including:
The ECM receives information from the sensors and switches and sends signals to the injectors, fuel shut off valve and engine brake relay.
